DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tissue Donor Chimerism Negation Separate Percentage Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A percentage value regarding the negation of separation of a laboratory procedure of a tissue donor chimerism.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tissue Donor Chimerism Negation Separate Percentage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Independent; not united or joint._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Donor Chimerism Negation Separate Percentage
Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Independent; not united or joint.:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
